billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO INVESTIGATIONS AND GOVERNMENT OPERATIONS

title: Provides for creation of a legislative budget office
summary: Provides for creation of a non-partisan legislative budget office to perform budget analysis to determine the funding levels necessary to the operation of governmental departments and programs and render anticipated revenue estimates for each fiscal year, examine and review all financial information of the state for the purpose of rendering revenue estimates used in determining whether the proposed state budget is balanced, be charged with the duty of rendering anticipated revenue forecast reports to the legislature and the governor for the purposes of facilitating passage of the state budget in a timely manner, provide assistance in determining the fiscal impact of proposed legislation, and submit to the state legislature written estimates of anticipated state revenues on January 15, April 15, July 15 and October 15 of each year.

       AN ACT to amend the legislative law, in  relation  to  creation  of  the
         legislative budget office

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The legislative law is amended by adding a new article  5-C
    2  to read as follows:
    3                                 ARTICLE 5-C
    4                          LEGISLATIVE BUDGET OFFICE
    5  SECTION 88-K. NON-PARTISAN LEGISLATIVE BUDGET OFFICE.
    6          88-L.  POWERS  AND DUTIES OF THE NON-PARTISAN LEGISLATIVE BUDGET
    7                 OFFICE.
    8    S 88-K.  NON-PARTISAN  LEGISLATIVE  BUDGET  OFFICE.  THERE  IS  HEREBY
    9  CREATED A NON-PARTISAN LEGISLATIVE BUDGET OFFICE.
   10    S  88-L.  POWERS  AND  DUTIES  OF  THE NON-PARTISAN LEGISLATIVE BUDGET
   11  OFFICE.  1. THE NON-PARTISAN LEGISLATIVE  BUDGET  OFFICE  SHALL  PERFORM
   12  BUDGET  ANALYSIS TO DETERMINE THE FUNDING LEVELS NECESSARY TO THE OPERA-
   13  TION OF GOVERNMENTAL DEPARTMENTS AND  PROGRAMS  AND  RENDER  ANTICIPATED
   14  REVENUE  ESTIMATES FOR EACH FISCAL YEAR. SUCH REVENUE ESTIMATES SHALL BE
   15  USED EXCLUSIVELY FOR PURPOSES OF DETERMINING BUDGET EXPENDITURES.
   16    2. THE DIRECTOR OF THE NON-PARTISAN LEGISLATIVE  BUDGET  OFFICE  SHALL
   17  EXAMINE  AND  REVIEW  ALL  FINANCIAL  INFORMATION  OF  THE STATE FOR THE
   18  PURPOSE OF RENDERING REVENUE ESTIMATES USED IN DETERMINING  WHETHER  THE
   19  PROPOSED STATE BUDGET IS BALANCED.
   20    3.  THE  NON-PARTISAN  LEGISLATIVE  BUDGET OFFICE SHALL BE HEADED BY A
   21  DIRECTOR WHO SHALL BE APPOINTED BY A JOINT RESOLUTION OF THE SENATE  AND
   22  ASSEMBLY  FOR  A  TERM  OF FIVE YEARS. HE OR SHE SHALL DEVOTE HIS OR HER
   23  FULL TIME AND EFFORT TO THE OFFICE OF DIRECTOR AND HE OR SHE SHALL  HOLD

    1  NO  OTHER PUBLIC OFFICE. THE DIRECTOR SHALL RECEIVE SUCH COMPENSATION AS
    2  MAY BE FIXED BY THE OFFICE. THE DIRECTOR MAY  APPOINT  BUDGET  ANALYSTS,
    3  ASSISTANTS  AND  SUCH OTHER EMPLOYEES AS HE OR SHE MAY DEEM NECESSARY OR
    4  DESIRABLE,  PRESCRIBE THEIR DUTIES AND FIX THEIR COMPENSATION WITHIN THE
    5  AMOUNTS APPROPRIATED AND MADE AVAILABLE THEREFOR.
    6    4. THE NON-PARTISAN LEGISLATIVE BUDGET OFFICE SHALL  BE  CHARGED  WITH
    7  THE DUTY OF RENDERING ANTICIPATED REVENUE FORECAST REPORTS TO THE LEGIS-
    8  LATURE  AND THE GOVERNOR FOR THE PURPOSES OF FACILITATING PASSAGE OF THE
    9  STATE BUDGET IN A TIMELY MANNER. THE  DIRECTOR  MAY  REQUEST  AND  SHALL
   10  RECEIVE  FROM ALL PUBLIC OFFICERS, DEPARTMENTS, AGENCIES AND AUTHORITIES
   11  OF THE STATE AND ITS POLITICAL SUBDIVISIONS, SUCH ASSISTANCE AND DATA AS
   12  SHALL BE NECESSARY TO PROJECT ANTICIPATED STATE REVENUES  FOR  BUDGETARY
   13  PURPOSES.
   14    5. THE NON-PARTISAN LEGISLATIVE BUDGET OFFICE SHALL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE
   15  IN DETERMINING THE FISCAL IMPACT OF PROPOSED LEGISLATION.
   16    6.  THE  NON-PARTISAN  LEGISLATIVE  BUDGET  OFFICE SHALL SUBMIT TO THE
   17  LEGISLATURE WRITTEN ESTIMATES OF ANTICIPATED STATE REVENUES  ON  JANUARY
   18  FIFTEENTH, APRIL FIFTEENTH, JULY FIFTEENTH AND OCTOBER FIFTEENTH OF EACH
   19  YEAR.
   20    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
